text: Calocochlea pan is a species of large air-breathing land snail, a pulmonate gastropod mollusk in the family Bradybaenidae. This species is very common in the Philippines. The shell is between 41 and 47 millimeters long with brown spiral bands and a cream-colored background.ABBOTT, R.T. 1989: Compendium of landshells: a colour guide to more than 2,000 of the Worldâ€™s Terrestrial Shells. American Malacologists Inc., Burlington, USA. pp.171. ==References== ==Other websites== * Animal Life Forms: Calocochlia pan * BioLib:Calocochlia pan W. J.
